thread.title: Food by Jude: Fall temps can inspire desire for hearty foods
thread.title_full: Food by Jude: Fall temps can inspire desire for hearty foods

title: Food by Jude: Fall temps can inspire desire for hearty foods
text: 1 pumpkin (4 to 5 pounds), short and fat Butter-flavored pan spray 2 tablespoons sugar, for pumpkin shell 1/3 cup sugar 1 cup evaporated skim milk 1 cup 2 percent low-fat milk 1/4 cup no-trans-fat butter spread, butter or margarine 2 cups bread cubes, stale, with crusts 3/4 cup liquid egg substitute 2/3 cup dried cranberries 1/2 teaspoon pumpkin pie spice Whipped topping, frozen yogurt or ice cream as accompaniment Wash the pumpkin. Cut off top to make a “lid.” Using a sharp-edged spoon, scoop out seeds and fibers from pumpkin. Spray inside with the buttery-flavored pan spray and sprinkle with the 2 tablespoons of sugar. Replace lid. Place in a baking pan and bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. (convection 325 for 18 minutes). Place bread cubes in a large bowl and set aside. Make the filling: Pour milks into a saucepan. Add buttery spread and 1/3 cup sugar. Heat until buttery spread melts. Remove from heat, pour over bread cubes and let stand for 5 minutes. Mix eggs, cranberries and spices. Combine with bread-cube mixture. Pour into pumpkin. Return to oven, uncovered, and bake for 1 hour 30 minutes to 1 hour 45 minutes or until custard is set (convection oven 1 hour 15 minutes to 1 hour 25 minutes). Let rest for 10 minutes before serving. Custard will puff up through the opening, but will settle down. Cut into wedges to serve. Per serving: 177 calories; 5g fat; 28g carbohydrates; 154mg sodium Follow UnionDemocrat.com
